lead_paragraph: COFFIN--Edmund (Ned), of Strafford, VT, entrepreneur, political activist, beloved father of five and grandfather of thirteen, died peacefully on April 18. Born in New York City in 1921, Ned attended Yale, served in the Navy in WWII, and launched businesses in post-colonial Nigeria. He and his late wife of fifty-eight years, Violet Bodman Coffin, moved from New York to Strafford, where he founded a wind-energy company, and the couple became indefatigable organizers of Vermont Democratic Party politics. Ned is survived by his sister Margot Lindsay, sister-in-law Randy Wilson Coffin, widow of the late William Sloane Coffin Jr., children--Judy, Doug, Tad, Cris, and Andy--and their families, many nieces and nephews, and dear friend of many years, Lou Hance. A memorial service will be held May 15 at 1pm in Strafford, VT. 1/3
